page.title: 02Quarry Moor-A Playground!
page.content: {Quarry Moor}is a piece of derelict land to the south of{Ripon.}It was once a quarry for{Magnesian Limestone. The late{Alderman T.F. Spence bequeathed the land to the city with the instruction that it was "to be kept as a children's playground for all time"The city council was not able to fulfil this wish and a group of local people set up{the"Quarry Moor {Development Association"}with the sole purpose of developing the moor in accordance with T.F.Spence's wishes. The ownership of the land has been uncertain for sometime. In 1974, Harrogate Borough Council took over the lease due to local government reorganisation. But the Charity Commissioners, who have been investigating who the rightful owner of the land is, have come out in favour of{Ripon City Council.
